item.title: Step 1 - Getting Started
item.description: Getting status Let’s review the chifra status command. It should produce output similar to this: Client: Geth/v1.11.5-stable-a38f4108/linux-amd64/go1.20.2 (archive, not tracing) TrueBlocks: GHC-TrueBlocks//1.0.0-release (no eskey, no pinkey) Chain Details: sepolia (11155111/11155111) Root Config Path: $HOME/.local/share/trueblocks/ Chain Config Path: $HOME/.local/share/trueblocks/config/sepolia/ Cache Path: $HOME/.local/share/trueblocks/cache/sepolia/ Index Path: $HOME/.local/share/trueblocks/unchained/sepolia/ Progress: 4259662, 0, 0, 0 ts: 4438781 A few things you’ll notice: The paths listed in the middle of the output may come in handy for configuration.

item.title: Step 2 - Getting Data
item.description: We’re finally able to get some data from the chain. But are we? Let’s find out. Run this command: chifra TrueBlocks is a collection of command line tools. Notice the two groups: Chain Data and Chain State. Similar to the RPC, these tools pull data directly from the node. With a few improvements… Getting data Try any of these commands: chifra blocks 2001007 chifra transactions --fmt json 0xc9c5f47ed17445070a68fab0c5336f39e6a70a74c67c8fce2a586b5f6596b3fb chifra receipts --fmt json 4001009.

item.title: Step 3 - Getting Details
item.description: Step 3 - Getting Details Let’s dig deeper. Let’s query specific addresses. In other words, snoop. Note: chances are very high that if you’re not running your own node, you will get rate limted with these commands. Do this: chifra names GitCoin:Grants This command shows about 1,900 GitCoin grants from past rounds. Add a selector to the command: chifra names GitCoin:Grants -s 291 | tee grants.txt # `291` is random. It just picks address that have 291 in them.

item.title: Step 4 - Getting Serious
item.description: Step 4 - Getting Serious In this step, we’ll start to use the command line interface (CLI) to do some serious work. We’ll start by looking at the chifra command, which is the CLI for the chifra package. This package is the core of TrueBlocks and is used by all the other packages. It is the package that does the heavy lifting of reading the blockchain, caching the data, and providing the data to the other packages.
